fields.title: Pledge today to support a fast Hyku 7 release - fundraising drive for May 2025

content.value: The Hyku Community is
fundraising to fast-track critical upgrade work
required for platform performance, security, and quality. The goal of this fundraising is to ensure this work is completed by the end of summer 2025.
The goal: Release Hyku 7 by the End of Summer 2025
One of our Samvera Community Partner Service Providers, Notch8, has secured Rob Kaufman to lead this essential upgrade work which includes:
Integrating the latest Hyrax 5.1 into Hyku
Upgrading Ruby and Rails with full dependency resolution
Comprehensive testing and spec development
Rob has the experience to complete this work quickly, so that it is complete in time for community development work this fall.
Why does this work matter?

For both the Hyku and Hyrax communities to enjoy the “cross-pollination” of features and benefits of both, they both need to be on the same version of Rails, and share the same core Hyrax engine version.
This work
sets up both Hyrax and Hyku for improved quality
with fewer bugs
This work is
a required step to address performance issues
Less divergence (and more convergence) of both projects means
higher quality of releases through streamlined testing and a lower  maintenance burden
Timeline & Budget

Estimated completion: 2 months
Total budget: $20,000
Target release: August 2025
Our Pledge Goal: A $2,000 pledge from 10 different institutions by June 1, 2025

If 10 institutions can each pledge $2,000 toward this effort we will reach our goal. Some institutions may be able to contribute more if needed to help institutions who can’t reach the full contribution goal, so
contribution pledges of any amount are welcome
Why Crowdfund?

By distributing the cost across our community, we can move forward quickly without burdening any single institution. Your contribution, regardless of size, helps maintain the collaborative spirit that makes Hyku special.

If we're not able to reach the target budget, this work will still need to be completed, but it will happen more slowly and without the momentum of a dedicated sprint.
How to Pledge
Email
heather@samvera.org
with your pledge amount. Contributions will be invoiced after June 1st.

fields.title: Join Our May Community Sprints – Everyone’s Welcome!

content.value: We’re excited to invite you to Samvera’s upcoming
Community Sprints

this May! These virtual sprints bring people together to enhance code and documentation. Whether you're a developer, metadata specialist, repository administrator, or in any other role, there’s a place for you to contribute.
Upcoming Sprints
Documentation Sprint

(May 12–16)
Led by the Documentation Working Group, this sprint focuses on improving FAQs, installation guides, functionality descriptions, and more. Whether you’re an experienced writer or new to documentation, your input will help make resources clearer and more accessible.
Sign up for the Documentation Sprint
Development Sprint

(May 19–23)
Join the Product Owners and Tech Leads of Avalon, Hyku, and Hyrax to work on high-priority community features. This is a great opportunity to contribute code, learn from experienced developers, and collaborate on impactful projects.
Sign up for the Development Sprint
Whether you can join for a day or the full week, your participation makes a difference!
